discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Dalgona Challenges web application (Werkzeug/Flask Python) - Port 5000, HTTP only

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure vulnerabilities, broken links/incomplete functionality, missing authentication on admin/challenge endpoints, and potential access control issues. Verify if challenge endpoints are meant to be accessible but returning 404 due to misconfiguration or intentionally disabled.
targets.rationale: The web application serves as the main interface for accessing security challenges. The homepage shows a link to /xss25 challenge but the endpoint returns 404, indicating either misconfiguration or incomplete implementation. Should test if there are hidden endpoints, alternative access methods, or authentication bypass opportunities to access challenges.

targets.objective: Test for directory traversal vulnerabilities, arbitrary file access, and information disclosure through static resource access. Verify if directory listing is enabled or if files can be accessed via path traversal techniques.
targets.rationale: Static resources are served from /static/ path. Should verify if path traversal attacks can be used to access files outside the static directory, and if directory listing reveals sensitive files or application structure.

targets.objective: Enumerate all accessible endpoints and HTTP methods. Test for hidden endpoints, parameter injection, XXE, and API-based vulnerabilities. Verify if there are undocumented API endpoints for challenge management or submission.
targets.rationale: Application may have undocumented API endpoints beyond the visible homepage. Should systematically test common API patterns and backend functionality that may not be exposed through the web interface.

keyFindings: [LOW] Application homepage contains broken link to /xss25 endpoint - indicates incomplete implementation or misconfiguration
[LOW] Werkzeug/Flask development server details exposed in Server header - version information disclosure
[LOW] No authentication mechanism observed on any endpoint - application appears to be open/public
[LOW] Static resources publicly accessible from /static/ path - verify if sensitive files are exposed
[LOW] Challenge endpoint returns 404 despite being referenced in homepage - functional gap in application
